pages.title: Murad Qasaimeh
pages.text: Welcome! This is the home page. You can edit source/index.md to add your intro, links, or a summary of your work.

pages.title: Curriculum
pages.text: CareerMTS Software Engineer, AMD (Full‑time) Location: San Jose, California, United States Dates: Aug 2022 – Present Highlights: Enabling development of compilers, simulators, and performance analysis tools for AI/ML engines. Developing an end‑to‑end compiler for ML frameworks targeting AMD AIE devices using LLVM and MLIR. Lead Software Engineer, Cadence Design Systems (Full‑time) Location: San Jose, California, United States Dates: Sep 2020 – Jul 2022 (1 yr 11 mos) Research Assistant, Iowa State University Location: Ames, Iowa Dates: Sep 2015 – Jun 2020 (4 yrs 10 mos) Research Engineer Intern, Xilinx Location: San Jose, California Dates: May 2018 – Nov 2018 (7 mos) Education SkillsProgramming LanguagesI often program using C/C++, CUDA, CMake, and Python. I also have experience with Java, Scala, Haskell, MATLAB, JavaScript, and R, and have completed at least one large project with each. Machine Learning and Deep Learning Natural Language Processing Computer Vision Speech Processing Statistical Methods Optimization Methods

pages.title: Projects
pages.text: Projects Structured Pruning for Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) Implemented magnitude‑based structured weight pruning to improve hardware performance by fixing NNZ per channel for better load balancing. Tech: Python, TensorFlow. CUDA Implementation of Sparse DNNs Built a high‑performance CUDA implementation for structurally sparse DNNs; benchmarked against cuDNN, cuBLAS, and cuSPARSE. Tech: C++, CUDA. Benchmarking Vision Kernels and NN Inference on Embedded Platforms Benchmarked accuracy, runtime, and energy across ARM A57 CPU, Nvidia Jetson TX2 GPU, and Xilinx ZCU102 FPGA. Tech: xFOpenCV, OpenCV, VisionWorks.
